page.title: 17Libraries in East Leicester
page.content: {St.Barnabas Library;}The library on St.Barnabas Rd.was built in 1937 but has altered a lot over the years. There are over 80,000 books,some of them in other languages such as Polish & Urdu. Monday is the busiest day & fiction the most popular book. Other services include records,tapes & photo copying. The library is very much part of the community with play schemes & clubs for the able & disabled. Services for children include story reading,book clubs & the reading bus that visits local venues during school holidays.{ {Humberstone Library}used to be in the old village chapel but despite controversy it was closed in 1983. In response partly to local protests a mobile library was provided.This, however,proved to be a poor substitute & a new library has been built.
